page.title: 19LOCAL SETTLEMENTS
page.content: The survey area contains relatively few settlements which is perhaps surprising in a densely populated part of Britain. The rural landscape is still dominated by scattered villages and hamlets but the structure of these is very different today than it was even a century ago. Today there are very few people who actually live and work in these settlements yet their populations are for the most part higher than they were when the community was dominated by agriculture. The reasons for this is the much reduced need for workers in farming with the introduction of machinery on a wide scale, and today's increased mobility through the use of the motor car which has allowed the more wealthy to buy desirable homes in the country and for them to commute to work in the towns.
